page.title: 01General Review of the Area
page.content: The area covered in the 3x4 block is mostly farmland, crossed by several metalled minor roads connecting West Ashton, Steeple Ashton, Heywood, Bratton and Edington, and some unmetalled farm tracks, bridleways and footpaths. The south east corner of the block is crossed by the Westbury - Newbury railway line. Housing is confined to the S.W. end of West Ashton village,the two small farming hamlets of East Town and Dunge, Capps Lane, and isolated farms. Dunge Farm is noted by The Dept of the Environment for being a medieval moated site. In the area of the block due south of Steeple Ashton village a few derelict airforce buildings and concrete roadways can be seen, remnants of the days when Keevil airfield was used by the R.A.F.
